content.description: Start on a good 2 finger pocket with your left hand, and a right hand sidepull or sloper depending on how you hold it. Then work your way straight up to a good crimp for your left hand and difficult feet (because of lack of sight) and continue up to a good ledge. From here drop down because the topout is very bad and the downclimb is even worse.
content.protection: 1-2 pads (good flat landing, but above both grass and concrete.)
content.location: In the middle of the wall, following the blast holes.

content.description: Start with a high left foot and a counterpressure movement on the arete. Climb the Arete using good crimps and sidepulls until you reach a ledge. Drop down from here due to a bad topout and an even worse downclimb.
content.location: The obvious 90 degree arete on the far right hand side of the wall

content.description: A nice wall with a good landing, but potential for some loose holds, so be careful.    This wall features a 90 degree arete with some potential for some laybacking and some interesting arete holds, and a good face climb with a very overgrown top.
